The Great Fire of London occurred in September 1666 and lasted for four days. It started in a bakery on Pudding Lane and quickly spread across the city, destroying more than 13,000 houses and numerous public buildings. Remarkably, only six people were recorded as having died in the fire. 

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
When did the Great Fire of London occur, where did it start, and how many people died?
Cite your source.
ENDINSTRUCTION

The Great Fire of London took place in September 1666 and lasted for four days. It began in a bakery on Pudding Lane and rapidly spread throughout the city, causing extensive damage to over 13,000 houses and several public buildings. Despite the widespread destruction, only six people were recorded as having died in the fire.

**Source:** [Historic UK](https://www.historic-uk.com/HistoryUK/HistoryofEngland/The-Great-Fire-of-London/)
